data.message: He doesn't seem to like Angular, that was obvious, however he doesn't provide a better alternative to some very important features like two-way binding.
Yes he does :) at the end of the Article he suggest ReactJS http://facebook.github.io/react/
haha, I considered whatever at the end as nothing worth reading

To be honest, I'm not against Angular nor in favor. thinking about Angular for managing a big user interface app or sticking to a specific framework doesn't make me feel comfortable. 

I normally think about are the problems and if the framework I will use will have all the answers i'm looking for :)

Flux+React however looks interesting. I recommend watching this Video here: http://facebook.github.io/flux/

Here is the full list of his suggestions
https://medium.com/este-js-framework/what-i-would-recommend-instead-of-angular-js-62b057d8a9e

Angular reminds me of Asp.net WebForms when you used to develop custom controls and take care of their data binding and rendering to make your form code look clean and encapsulate all details into reusable components, however all that was server side only which was pretty broken when you need to encapsulate javascript code too.
Angular uses almost the same pattern but on client side, with nice testability and Dependency injection support, but I see the potential problems that is inherently comes from that model, too many abstractions each has the potential of leaking some and you end up required to know every detail on how Angular works just to get something a little bit out of the normal pattern to work.\

I am using Angular for 8 months now in one of the most complicated Web Apps I ever worked on where everything is about run-time builders starting from defining the business and data models to reports designer and viewer. 
I do agree with Daniel on many of the down side points he mentioned in his article, but I don't regret using Angular in this project at all. It was for me like a life saver, too powerful and easy to use at the same time at least for me.
I don't recommend to use Angular for all web apps. it always depends. In some apps I don't even go with JavaScript Apps Frameworks if the server + some jQuery can handle the same with reasonable UX
